text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen guess 
where I am that's right I am at home in Bangkok

Thailand now many of you may know this but every 
time I'm here I always like to do little videos

about the Thai food culture so one of the best 
ways to learn about any food culture is to take

a look at this the everyday stuff that local 
people eat right right so I thought this year

I'm going to do a little series of videos called 
Pai's Thailand food vlog where I will show you just

the stuff that I'm me and my family and my friends 
are eating just on a regular everyday basis so

it'll be unplanned to be real and raw so what 
we're eating is what you're going to see so it'll

be lots of fun let's take a look at our first one 
hi guys so today in Pai's Thailand food vlog here is

what we're having for dinner we've got right 
in front of me a Thai style barbecue chicken

our gai yang I have a recipe for this so if you 
want to try and make that you can go check that

out and we've got two different types of papaya 
salad we've got one which is a Lao style papaya

salad without the thing that makes it Lao which 
is platter or fermented fish I talked about that

too so it's not little eggplants in it so that's 
a bit unique and then the other type of Rio salad

is a Thai style via salad with crab so these are 
crab pieces right there okay and then other than

that we've got these noodles here which are kind 
of like pad thai but not it's like karate style

and kuratas is a town my grandmother comes from 
and so she meet that so it's kind of like putt

Thai with different flavor okay and then other 
than that we've got that fish which is a grilled

fish the fish crusted with lots of salt stuffed 
with all sorts of herbs lemongrass and stuff and

then grilled and then finally these balls that 
I found them all they are kind of cool and new

so I got them to try it out and it's basically 
different types of Thai food so there's like

ice with curry and like rice that alap flavored 
and fried rice of different sorts and they just

turn basically Thai dishes into rice balls and 
then deep-fry them kind of like a dun cheney

so that's pretty cool I might try to remake that 
and make a video out of it so that's it we didn't

really make anything except the noodles today 
everything was bought from the mall and streets

and stuff like that and for dessert we are having 
today mango and sticky rice we all know what that

is and yes I have a recipe for that as well 
mangos a little overripe but that's okay it's

better than under right and then we're also 
having these which is called kinome sai sai

and i will show you what's inside take out this 
pic i used to have to make these wraps when I was

in school thunk thunk-thunk I know so small right 
so this is like a coconut custard the whole thing

is steamed and then in the middle it's a filling 
of coconut and palm sugar that's been wrapped in

like a sticky rice mochi like thingy it's really 
good it's one of my favorite desserts actually so
